page.title: 06TOURISM IN CASTLE STREET
page.content: The old centre of Portchester is Castle Street, and today it is still an important place for the locals. The Roman and Norman castle, a place of great historical interest is situated a the South Eastern end of Castle Street, and attracts many tourists visiting Southern England. Castle Street itself is steeped in history but visitors to Portchester are mainly interested in the Castle and do not realise how old the street is. Several of the houses have preservation orders on them, the oldest of which is a thatched cottage dating back to the 15th century. It is impossible to disassociate Castle Street from its past because its buildings are a living representation of the Portchester that was.
